result.execSummary:
The defendant Marco M. EDWARDS was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant in custody on WRIT.  
State moves to delete the enhancer.   Motion granted.   
Battery - No contest plea.   Convicted.   Defendant is sentenced to the Manitowoc County Jail for fifteen (15) days, under the Huber Law, to commence immediately.   Transfer to Kenosha County Jail is authorized.   Defendant must submit DNA sample.   $443.00 court costs imposed, to be paid by 03-21-16 or 8 days jail.   
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights.   
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.   
Minutes.

Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum and Order to Sheriff to transport defendant for Plea Hearing on 01-21-2016 at 1:30 p.m., Br. 2.
Copy filed.
Defendant's Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

Defendant in custody.    
Not guilty plea.  Jury Calendar.   Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 12-04-15 at 1:30 p.m.   Plea date is set for 12-23-15 at 11:20 a.m.    
Minutes.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of battery-dvo.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 11-30-15 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $500.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he have no assaultive contact with Robyn M. Skinkis, no travel outside Manitowoc County without the Court's approval and maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs.  Bail furnished and defendant is remanded into custody on a probation hold.
Minutes.
